title: organisations
description:
An Organisation is a type of Party (as opposed to a person). A business concern or a group of individuals that are bound by a common purpose, with or without a legal status. Organisations may be legal entities in their own right.
 
For example, MS Amlin and Maersk are organisations with legal status.

This collection applies the Tree and Graph design pattern since it stores a hierarchical structure in the same collection. The structure is as follows: Organisation, Company (child of an Organisation) and Branch (child of an Company) and all child documents have a parent field pointing to the parent document. https://www.mongodb.com/blog/post/building-with-patterns-the-tree-pattern

This collection also applies the Extended Reference pattern since all child documents have an Extended document to the top level document of the hierarchy (Organisation). https://www.mongodb.com/blog/post/building-with-patterns-the-extended-reference-pattern

---

LDM Ref: Organisation
$comment:
The organisations collection makes use of the [Mongo Polymorphic pattern](https://www.mongodb.com/developer/how-to/polymorphic-pattern/) where the combination of the type and role fields define the type model being stored.

The JSON Schema illustrates the different model types through [one-of](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/combining.html#oneof) schema composition.

_id.description:
A system-generated unique identifier for a Party with a format and structure defined by the technology used. As a technical attribute, it has no business meaning.

---

LDM Ref: Organisation.Party ID

creation_date.description: The date at which the entity was created.

creation_channel.description: Channel used to make the entity, e.g. OutSystems.

creation_user.description: _id of the user creating the entity.

modified_date.description: The date at which the change was made.

modified_channel.description: Channel used to make the change, e.g. OutSystems.

modified_user.description: _id of the user making the change.

first_published.description:
The date on which the organisation was onboarded.

---

LDM Ref: Organisation.Organisation Created Date

parent.description:
Field that stores the reference to the parent node that sits in the Organisations collection. This field exists to implement the Tree and Graph design pattern (https://www.mongodb.com/blog/post/building-with-patterns-the-tree-pattern).

The hierarchy is the following: Organisation (top-level), Company (child of an Organisation), Branch (child of a Company).

line_1.description:
The first line in the address of the party.

---

LDM Ref: Address Line 1

line_2.description:
The second line in the address of the party.

---

LDM Ref: Address Line 2

city.description:
The city in the address of the party.

---

LDM Ref: City

region.description:
The region in the address of the party.

---

LDM Ref: Region

country_code.description:
*Reference data**

The alpha-2 code that represents the country in the ISO 3166 standard.

---

LDM Ref: Country2 Character ISO Code

postcode.description:
The post code in the address of the party.

---

LDM Ref: Post Code

address.description:
The place where someone lives or an organisation is situated.

For example, British Airways as an insured has the address of Waterside, PO Box 365, Harmondsworth, UB7 0GB.

---

LDM Ref: Party Address

_xid.description: AzureAD oid for the corresponding object. The AzureAD oid is only being generated after the creation of the first version of the organisation. Only after that, the _xid can be updated as a GUID. This means that _xid value is an empty string between the creation of the organisation in MongoDB and the generation of the AzureAD oid.

name.description:
The given name of the party. For example "Joe Bloggs", "ABC Corp" etc.

---

LDM Ref: Party.Party Given Name

effective_from.description:
This field is populated and iterated when there is a business-relevant change. It allows users to identify the version of the data that was applied at a particular point in time.
 
For example if a participant on a contract goes bust and a new carrier joins the panel, the Effective To attribute on the former stamp’s record will be populated and a new record for the new stamp will be created with a populated Effective From attribute.

---

LDM Ref: Party.Effective From Datetime

effective_to.description:
This field is populated and iterated when there is a business-relevant change. It allows users to identify the version of the data that was applied at a particular point in time.
 
For example if a participant on a contract goes bust and a new carrier joins the panel, the Effective To attribute on the former stamp’s record will be populated and a new record for the new stamp will be created with a populated Effective From attribute.

---

LDM Ref: Party.Effective To Datetime

status.description: Calculated status indicating whether an entity is Active, Inactive or ParentInactive.

broker_codes.description:
A 4-digit code that represents a broker organisation. A broker can have multiple codes either as a result of historic M&A activity, or where each one is used to write specific classes of business.
 
For example Aon UK has broker codes 0430, 1219, 1622 etc.

---

LDM Ref: Broker Code

code.description:
A 4-digit code that represents a broker organisation. A broker can have multiple codes either as a result of historic M&A activity, or where each one is used to write specific classes of business.
 
For example Aon UK has broker codes 0430, 1219, 1622 etc.

---

LDM Ref: Broker Code.Broker Code

active.description: Boolean field that is associated with the Broker Code. When True the Broker Code is active, when False the Broker Code is inactive.

first_name.description:
The first name of the person. Where there is more than one first name, this will also be captured.

---

LDM Ref: Person.First Name

last_name.description:
The last name of the person.

---

LDM Ref: Person.Last Name

job_title.description:
The job role of the person.

---

telephone_number.description:
The telephone number of the person.

---

email.description:
The email address of the person. This is for contact information purposes and may not necessarily be the used for platform login.

---

LDM Ref: Person.Email Address

role.description:
**Reference data**

The type of role that a particular party can play.
 
For example Carrier, Broker.

LDM Ref: Party Role Type

Integration code. E.g. AL_Contract_Builder

auto_connect_stamps.description:
Defines which type of linking should apply to in the organisation structure.
All, select or none. The value applied at Organisation level is the default for any new Company.

---

LDM Ref: Broker Carrier Link.Automatically Connect All Stamps Indicator

carrier_associations.description:
A mapping table between Broker and Carrier. This captures the business relationship between a broker company and a carrier company. From PPL's perspective, this identifies which carriers brokers should contact for particular types of cover. The terms of these arrangements will be detailed in a Terms of Business Agreement, which is held by brokers and carriers outside of PPL.

---

LDM Ref: Broker Carrier Link

charging_entity.description:
Indicates that the Company is a charging entity when True.

---

LDM Ref: Organisation.Charging Entity Indicator

trade_associations.description:
A mapping table between Broker, Carrier and Trade Association Type.

---

LDM Ref: Trading Association

name.description:
The code that represents the trade association type.

---

LDM Ref: Trade Association.Trade Association Type Code

active.description: Field that specifies if a Trade Association is active. When True the Trade Association is active, False is inactive.

For example Carrier, Broker.

teams.description:
A team within a broker organisation that acts as an agent for insurance business. There will be defined cover placed by the broker.
 
For example, the UK property and casualty team within Aon.

---

LDM Ref: Broker Team

items.description:
A team within a broker organisation that acts as an agent for insurance business. There will be defined cover placed by the broker.
 
For example, the UK property and casualty team within Aon.

---

LDM Ref: Broker Team

_id.description:
A system-generated unique identifier for a Broker Team, with a format and structure defined by the technology used. As a technical attribute, it has no business meaning.

---

LDM Ref: Broker Team.Broker Team ID

_xid.description: AzureAD oid for the corresponding object. The AzureAD oid is only being generated after the creation of the first version of the team. Only after that, the _xid can be updated as a GUID. This means that _xid value is an empty string between the creation of the team in MongoDB and the generation of the AzureAD oid.

name.description:
The name of the broker team, as defined by the broker organisation.
  
For example "The UK property and casualty team".

---

LDM Ref: Broker Team.Broker Team Name
examples: The UK property and casualty team

email.description:
The email address of the carrier team.

---

LDM Ref: Carrier Team.Carrier Team Email

broker_codes.description: Array of broker codes that the team has access too, based on the broker codes available at the organisation level.

effective_from.description:
This field is populated and iterated when there is a business-relevant change. It allows users to identify the version of the data that was applied at a particular point in time.
 
For example if a participant on a contract goes bust and a new carrier joins the panel, the Effective To attribute on the former stamp’s record will be populated and a new record for the new stamp will be created with a populated Effective From attribute.

---

LDM Ref: Broker Team.Effective From Datetime

effective_to.description:
This field is populated and iterated when there is a business-relevant change. It allows users to identify the version of the data that was applied at a particular point in time.
 
For example if a participant on a contract goes bust and a new carrier joins the panel, the Effective To attribute on the former stamp’s record will be populated and a new record for the new stamp will be created with a populated Effective From attribute.

---

LDM Ref: Broker Team.Effective To Datetime

time_limitation.description:
Maximum number of days up until a correction can be made by the specific Broker Team.

---

LDM Ref: Broker Team.Limit of Days of Corrections

status.description:
Calculated status indicating whether an entity is active, inactive or parent inactive.

Based on effective_from, effective_to and the status of the Branch this Team belongs to.

endorsements_to_block_corrections.description: This field is used by the platform to block corrections after an endorsement is created. When true this field blocks the corrections when false it doesn't block corrections. Check OC141.

digital_document_access.description:
Defines whether the Broker Team has access rights to process Contracts via the digital document journey. This capability is provided through an integrated third-party. 

---

LDM Ref: Broker. Digital Document Access Indicator
